definitions.definition: Characterized by or feeling deep affliction or distress ; very miserable .
examples: I felt wretched after my wife died.

definitions.definition: Of an inferior or unworthy nature or social status ; contemptible , lowly .
examples: The street was full of wretched beggars dressed in rags.

definitions.definition: Of an insignificant , mean , or poor nature; miserable, paltry , worthless .
Of a person , etc.: behaving in a manner causing contempt ; base , despicable , wicked .
Of weather : causing much discomfort ; very unpleasant ; miserable.
Used to express annoyance towards or dislike of someone or something : bloody , damned .
examples: Will you please stop playing that wretched trombone!

main_definition: Characterized by or feeling deep affliction or distress ; very miserable .
